poem:
"Game's Graft, Player's Perception"

Games recluse in pixel caves, 
drawn down halls of algorithm's labyrinth.
Dogma's dragon breathes binary blaze,
weaving spells, numbing the enthusiast.
Yet one stirs the static sleep.
A phoenix, reborn in coded fire, 
thoughts tangled in its tale so deep,
tethers reality, the gamer's quire.
A device odyssey unravels true,
catharsis in virtuality's violent view.
